page.title: 17BRECHIN CIVIC WEEK
page.content: A Civic Week is held each year in early June although as the programme has grown in recent years some events have spilled over to later weeks.This year the final of the darts competition took place 3 weeks after the opening disco and Civic Queen competition.Events vary from sporting (bowling,swimming,golf,football), to factory visits,to hobbies(pet show, steam railway), to art exhibitions and musical evenings.Also a Fun Fair visits the site of the traditional "Taranty Market". A Pageant Day is held on the first Saturday of the week with decorated vehicles (this year the Young Wives Group, dressed as clowns, won),Pipe Bands,Highland Dancing,a Fun Run and sideshows,stalls and demonstrations by local clubs and organisations. Most of the community enjoy this time each year.
